marketNews.title: Legit Crash atau Cuma Profit Taking?
marketNews.content: Crash bukan terjadi saat orang ambil untung, tapi saat gak ada lagi yang mau beli. - hauw2x

tickerNews.title: BBCA: Net Profit 9M25 (+6% YoY) In Line With Expectations, Buyback Up to Rp5 T
tickerNews.content: Bank Central Asia ($BBCA) recorded net profit of 14.4 trillion rupiah in 3Q25 (+1% YoY, -3% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 43.4 trillion rupiah (+6% YoY), in line with expectations as it equals 75% of the consensus 2025F estimate (vs. 9M24: 75% realization in 2024). In general, BBCA's performance in 3Q25 was relatively in line with the monthly performance during the July-August 2025 period which we have written about, where the company was more cautious in extending credit and increasing provisions as a proactive measure. However, in the 3Q25 earnings call, we assessed that BBCA management tended to be more optimistic entering 4Q25 and 2026 generally, along with the prospect of macroeconomic improvement driven by increased government spending and the trend of declining interest rates.

tickerNews.title: BBCA Maintains 2025 Guidance, Indicates Higher Credit Growth Guidance for 2026
tickerNews.content: Management maintained the credit growth guidance for 2025 in the range of +6-8% YoY, with realization as of September 2025 reaching +8% YoY. Cost of Credit (CoC) is expected to be at the level of 0.5% by the end of 2025, which implies that CoC in 4Q25 will be lower than the position in 3Q25 which was at the level of 0.6%. The potential for lower CoC in 4Q25 is possible when looking at the trend of quarterly declining NPL in 3Q25, after rising sequentially in 1Q25 and 2Q25. For 2026, although no official guidance has been provided, BBCA management indicated that credit growth has the potential to be faster, possibly in the range of +8-10%. The potential for stronger loan volume growth and CASA, along with better asset quality, is expected to outweigh the impact of potential loan yield decline due to falling interest rates. BBCA management itself sees Bank Indonesia potentially cutting interest rates 1x until the end of 2025 and 3x during 2026.

tickerNews.title: BBCA Buyback and Dividend Prospects
tickerNews.content: BBCA management also announced that the company will conduct a buyback of up to 5 trillion rupiah in the period of October 22, 2025-January 19, 2026, with a maximum purchase price of 9,200 rupiah per share. Management explained that the fulfillment of the buyback fund realization will depend on market conditions, so there is a possibility that the total buyback conducted will not reach 5 trillion rupiah. In addition, BBCA management mentioned that they are still discussing the dividend distribution portion for the 2025 fiscal year. Nevertheless, we assess there is a potential increase in the dividend payout ratio (vs. 2024 DPR: 67.4%), given the strong capitalization of the company with CAR at 29.9% as of September 2025.

tickerNews.title: BBCA Key Takeaway
tickerNews.content: As we previously wrote in Stockbit Commentary, BBCA's performance in 3Q25 has the potential to be the lowest before starting to accelerate in 4Q25, which is also reflected in the guidance provided by the company. BBCA itself has strengthened by +7.9% in the last 2 days and as of Monday (20/10) is traded at a valuation of 3.2x 1-Year Forward P/BV, about -2.5 standard deviations below the 5-year historical average. With attractive valuation and prospects for future performance improvement, we have a positive view on the banking sector, including BBCA.

tickerNews.title: ASSA 9M25: Net Profit +64% YoY
tickerNews.content: $ASSA: Adi Sarana Armada recorded net profit of 143 billion rupiah in 3Q25 (+70% YoY, +39% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 9M25 to 349 billion rupiah (+64% YoY). The annual increase in net profit, both in 3Q25 and 9M25, was driven by: 1) solid revenue growth; and 2) margin expansion. Total revenue in 3Q25 and 9M25 grew by +24% YoY and +21% YoY respectively, mainly driven by revenue from the 'delivery and logistics services' segment which increased by +46% YoY in 3Q25 and +39% YoY in 9M25. Operating profit margin also experienced expansion, reflected in operating profit growing faster than revenue growth, amounting to +42% YoY in 3Q25 and +49% YoY during 9M25.

tickerNews.title: PTBA Records Coal Production Volume Up 9 Percent in Third Quarter 2025
tickerNews.content: $PTBA: Corporate Secretary Division Head Bukit Asam, Eko Prayitno, said that they recorded a coal production volume of 35.9 million tons in 9M25 (+8.9% YoY), equivalent to ~72% of the 2025 target of 50 million tons. Meanwhile, coal sales volume during 9M25 reached 33.7 million tons (+7.7% YoY), equivalent to ~67% of the 2025 target of 50 million tons. The domestic market contributed 56% of total sales during 9M25, while the remainder went to the export market. Meanwhile, PTBA Director, Turino Yulianto, said that they will start implementing the coal downstreaming project into dimethyl ether (DME) starting next year, although he did not detail which party would be a partner in the project. Turino explained that PTBA has reserved 800 million tons of coal for downstreaming, adding that 1 DME plant requires an investment of US$2.5 billion or ~40 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: ADRO Increases Ownership in ADMR
tickerNews.content: $ADMR: The controller of Alamtri Minerals Indonesia, Alamtri Resources Indonesia ($ADRO), purchased 231 million shares of ADMR at an average price of 1,435 rupiah per share on October 16, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~331.5 billion rupiah. After this transaction, ADRO's direct ownership stake in ADMR increased from ~84.45% to ~85.02%.

tickerNews.title: Hapsoro Reduces Ownership in BUVA
tickerNews.content: $BUVA: The controller of Bukit Uluwatu Villa, Hapsoro, sold ~710 million BUVA shares on October 15, 2025, at an average price of 815 rupiah per share. The total transaction value reached ~579 billion rupiah and was intended to realize investment gains and portfolio alignment. After this transaction, Hapsoro's direct ownership stake in BUVA decreased from 3.99% to 0.54%.

tickerNews.title: ACES's Same Store Sales Growth Contracts in 9M25
tickerNews.content: $ACES: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia recorded same store sales growth (SSSG) of -8.2% YoY in September 2025 (vs. August 2025: -4.1% YoY, September 2024: +8.8% YoY). This result caused SSSG during 9M25 to contract by -3.6% YoY (vs. 9M24: +9.8% YoY), below the 2025 target which aims for more than +1% YoY. During 9M25, SSSG experienced a slowdown in all regions, with the Outside Java region at -1.7% YoY, Java outside Jakarta at -4.6% YoY, and Jakarta at -4.7% YoY.

tickerNews.title: BREN Subsidiary Starts First Exploration Well Drilling in North Maluku
tickerNews.content: $BREN: Barito Renewables Energy through its subsidiary, PT Star Energy Geothermal Indonesia, started drilling the first exploration well in the Hamding area, North Maluku. This activity is part of the preliminary survey and exploration assignment given by the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources in 2018. In the initial stage, this geothermal project targets an installed capacity of 50 MW out of a total planned development of 300 MW, with estimated geothermal resource potential reaching 275-550 MW.

tickerNews.title: LPKR Subsidiary to Acquire 100% Stake in PT Karya Sentra Sejahtera
tickerNews.content: $LPKR: Lippo Karawaci through 2 of its business entities - PT Abadi Jaya Sakti and PT Tigamitra Ekamulia - signed an agreement to acquire 100% of the shares of PT Karya Sentra Sejahtera from a non-affiliated party. The total planned transaction value reaches 332.2 billion rupiah, before adjustments that will be made, including existing debt and CAPEX commitments. PT Karya Sentra Sejahtera is the owner of the Imperial Aryaduta Hotel & Country Club, a 5-star hotel located in the Lippo Karawaci area, Tangerang.

tickerNews.title: CDIA CEO Increases Direct Ownership in CDIA
tickerNews.content: $CDIA: President Director of Chandra Daya Investasi, Fransiskus Ruly Aryawan, purchased 600,000 CDIA shares at an average price of 1,989 rupiah per share on October 16, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~1.2 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the direct ownership stake of Fransiskus Ruly Aryawan in CDIA increased from 0.004% to 0.0045%.

tickerNews.title: DVLA Plans to Distribute Interim Dividend FY2025
tickerNews.content: $DVLA: Darya-Varia Laboratoria plans to distribute an interim dividend for the 2025 fiscal year amounting to ~45.9 billion rupiah or 41 rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of 2.5% as of Monday (20/10). The cum dividend date in the regular and negotiation market is October 29, 2025, while payment will be on November 17, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Economic Consensus Forecasts Bank Indonesia Will Cut BI Rate to 4.5%
tickerNews.content: Economist consensus predicts Bank Indonesia will cut the BI Rate by -25 bps to the level of 4.5% in the announcement of the Board of Governors Meeting (RDG) on Wednesday (22/10), according to the latest survey compiled by Reuters. This expectation is based on the forecast that Bank Indonesia will give greater weight to efforts to boost economic growth, even though the rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar continues to weaken. Last month, Bank Indonesia unexpectedly cut the BI Rate by -25 bps, reflecting an "all-out pro-growth" stance along with the government's expansive fiscal policy. Economic consensus also expects the BI Rate to be cut to the level of 4.25% by the end of 2025 and remain at that level throughout 2026.

tickerNews.title: President Prabowo Sets Nutritional Meal Target, Addresses Food Poisoning Incident
tickerNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto on Monday (20/10) said that the National Nutrition Agency targets the number of recipients of the Free Nutritious Meal to reach 40 million people as of Monday (20/10), although President Prabowo stated that he did not want to force this target. For context, the National Nutrition Agency last week projected that recipients of the Free Nutritious Meal program would reach 70 million recipients by the end of 2025, about -15% lower than the initial target of 83 million recipients. President Prabowo mentioned that he had ordered the National Nutrition Agency to establish strict procedures, adding that food poisoning incidents are unacceptable.

tickerNews.title: US President Trump States 100 Percentage Point Tariff Threat on China is Not Sustainable
tickerNews.content: US President, Donald Trump, said on Friday (17/10) that his threat last week regarding an additional tariff of 100 percentage points for China was "not sustainable". Trump also confirmed that he will meet with Chinese President, Xi Jinping, at the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation meeting in South Korea, which will be held on October 31-November 1, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Spot Gold Price Drops, Traders Focus on US-China Trade
tickerNews.content: The price of gold in the spot market dropped -1.73% to US$4,251.82 per troy ounce at the close of trading on Friday (17/10), marking the largest daily decrease since May 2025. The decline in gold prices occurred after US President, Donald Trump, said that his threat regarding additional tariffs on China was "not sustainable." On Monday (20/10), the price of gold was relatively flat, strengthening to ~US$4,264 per troy ounce. Bloomberg reported that market players are now focusing on the upcoming meeting between the US and China, after Trump expressed optimism over the weekend that negotiations with China could result in an agreement to ease the trade crisis. Signs of progress in the US-China deal could lower the demand for safe haven assets, such as gold.

tickerNews.title: China's Economic Growth Slowed to +4.8% YoY in 3Q25
tickerNews.content: China's national statistics bureau recorded that China's economic growth slowed to +4.8% YoY in 3Q25 (vs. 2Q25: +5.2% YoY), in line with consensus expectations although marking the lowest level since 3Q24. This result brought China's economic growth over 9M25 to +5.2% YoY, higher than the Chinese government's target of around +5% YoY growth throughout 2025.

tickerNews.title: Ceramic Production Volume Estimated to Rise to 335 Million m2 per Quarter III 2025 amid Utilization Increase
tickerNews.content: The Chairman of the Indonesian Ceramic Industry Association (Asaki), Edy Suyanto, said that they estimate the ceramic production volume during 9M25 grew around +8% YoY to the range of 330-335 million square meters, in line with the utilization increase during 9M25 to about 72% (vs. 2024: 63%). Challenges for the industry include suboptimal utilization of specific natural gas prices (HGBT), ceramic raw material supply challenges, and a significant surge in ceramic imports from Malaysia, Vietnam, and India. Asaki is investigating this import surge, which is suspected to be unfair trade and transshipment products from China to avoid anti-dumping and safeguard duties.

tickerNews.title: MTLA Marketing Sales Reached Rp1.34 Trillion per Third Quarter 2025
tickerNews.content: Kontan reported that Metropolitan Land ($MTLA) recorded marketing sales of approximately 1.35 trillion rupiah during 9M25 (+4.3% YoY), equivalent to ~67% of the 2025 target of 2 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: GZCO Clarifies No Official Discussion on Acquisition by Happy Hapsoro's Affiliated Party
tickerNews.content: Gozco Plantations ($GZCO) stated in a clarification to the IDX that there was no official information, communication, or discussion between the company and PT Energi Melayani Negeri - a company affiliated with Happy Hapsoro, the husband of the DPR RI Speaker, Puan Maharani - or any party representing them regarding plans to acquire the company's shares. GZCO's clarification emerged after Emitennews reported that PT Energi Melayani Negeri would take over about half of GZCO's shares.
